page.title: 04Farming (General)
page.content: The area is predominantly Agricultural with the exception of, in the North-East corner, the Airport and Kirkhill Industrial Estate and, in the North-West corner, Kirkhill Forest. The proximity of the Urban Market combined with the nature of the soil and terrain, have resulted in a greater emphasis on Pastoral rather than Arable farming. A large proportion of the Agricultural land in this area is owned and farmed by the Rowett and Craibstone Research Institutes which, although world-renowned, are not representative of the farms in the surrounding area, being involved, among many other things, in the raising of such exotic species as deer.
